sentences.en: After market of encroach on player, how will be windstorm image sound answered?
sentences.cn: 在染指播放器市场后, 暴风影音将如何应对?

sentences.en: As human populations grow, the encroach on these fertile grasslands increases.
sentences.cn: 人口增长增加了对肥沃草地的需求.

sentences.en: Asking them to permit Russia to encroach upon Chinese territory.
sentences.cn: 承认沙俄通过不平等条约侵害中国的历史事实.

sentences.en: Does the house become yours if you encroach on it?
sentences.cn: 在你侵占这所房子前,你有合法拥有过 吗 ?

sentences.en: His new farm buildings encroach on his neighbour's land.
sentences.cn: 他新建的农场房子侵占了邻居的田地.

sentences.en: In Anekal farmers encroach on the forest, disrupting a migratory route.
sentences.cn: 在Anekal农民 们侵占森林, 阻断了大象迁徙的线路.

sentences.en: It will not encroach on important structures.
New housing is starting to encroach upon the surrounding fields.
sentences.cn: 新住宅开始延伸到周围的田地.

sentences.en: Newspaper articles assured the Soviets that the German Lebensraum did not encroach on Russian territory.
sentences.cn: 报纸的文章向俄国人保证说,德国的生存空间不会扩张到俄国的领土.

sentences.en: One could not encroach upon the other.
Our army must cherish the people and never encroach on their interests.
sentences.cn: 我们的军队必须爱护人民,决不能损害人民利益.

sentences.en: Some encroach on woodlands, raising environmental red flags.
sentences.cn: 有些甚至侵入林地, 使环境亮起红灯.

sentences.en: The encroach process includes conglutination, spore germination, penetration, growth and host death.
sentences.cn: 它对寄主侵染过程包括粘附 、 子萌发 、 透虫体 、 内发育和致死.

sentences.en: The new institutions do not encroach on political power.
sentences.cn: 这些新机构没有侵犯到政治权力。

sentences.en: The shrubs encroached ever more on the twisting drive.
sentences.cn: 灌木丛蚕食了越来越多蜿蜒的车道。

sentences.en: Traditionally men have compartmentalized their lives, never letting their personal lives encroach upon their professional lives.
sentences.cn: 传统上男人把自己的生活划分清楚，他们不会让私生活影响其工作。

sentences.en: Whether did this encroach the individual's privacy counterpoise, both produced conflict.
sentences.cn: 这是否侵犯了个人的隐私权, 两者产生了冲突.

trans.tran_en: to gradually take more of someone’s time, possessions, rights etc than you should
to gradually take more of someone’s time, possessions, rights etc than you should

trans.tran_cn: 侵入，侵犯，侵略，侵占，侵害，侵蚀
